Dataset handling#

Measurement datasets are a central part in model validation and therefore we designed the Dataset class class that offer a number of useful methods to deal with them.

There are two ways for creating a Dataset class.

  1. Through a list of Signals

  2. Through a specific structure pandas DataFrame

Signal type#

If the logged signals that you want to use as dataset are not sampled with the same sampling period, then you must convert them into dymoval Signal type objects.

A Dataset class object - which is what you need at the end - can be instantiated through a list of Signal type objects.

Dymoval Signal type are typeddict with the following keys

Keys

Signal.name

Signal name.

Signal.values()

Signal values.

Signal.signal_unit

Signal unit.

Signal.sampling_period

Signal sampling period.

Signal.time_unit

Signal sampling period.

Functions on signals

Dymoval offers few function for dealing with Signal type. Such functions are the following

signals_validation(signal_list)

Perform a number of checks to verify that the passed list of Signals can be used to create a Dataset.

fix_sampling_periods(signal_list[, ...])

Resample the Signals in the signal_list.

plot_signals(signal_list[, u_labels, y_labels])

Plot the Signals of a signal list.

Dataset class#

The Dataset class class is used to store and manipulate datasets. Since model validation requires a datasets, this class is used also to instantiate objects of class ValidationSession class.

A Dataset class object can be instantiated in two ways

  1. Through a list of dymoval Signals,

  2. Through a pandas DataFrame with a specific structure.

See signals_validation() and dataframe_validation() functions for more information.

Constructor

Dataset(name, signal_list, u_labels, y_labels)

The Dataset class stores the signals that you want to use as dataset and it provides methods for analyzing and manipulating them.

Attributes

Dataset.name

Dataset name.

Dataset.dataset

Actual dataset.

Dataset.coverage

Coverage statistics in terms of mean value and variance

Dataset.information_level

Not implemented yet!

Manipulation methods

Dataset.remove_means(*[, u_labels, y_labels])

Remove the mean value to the specified signals.

Dataset.remove_offset(*, u_list, y_list)

Remove a specified offset to the list of specified signals.

Dataset.low_pass_filter(*[, u_list, y_list])

Low-pass filter a list of specified signals.

Dataset.replace_NaNs([method, fill_value])

Replace NaN:s in the dataset.

Plotting methods

Dataset.plot(*[, u_labels, y_labels, ...])

Plot the Dataset.

Dataset.plot_coverage(*[, u_labels, ...])

Plot the dataset coverage as histograms.

Dataset.plot_amplitude_spectrum(*[, ...])

Plot the amplitude spectrum of the dataset and return the FFT of the specified signals.

Other methods

Dataset.get_signal_list()

Return the list of signal names of the dataset.

Dataset.get_dataset_values()

Return the dataset values as a tuple of numpy ndarrays corresponding to the tuple (t,u,y).

Dataset.export_to_mat(filename)

Write the dataset in a .mat file.

Functions over Datasets

dataframe_validation(df, u_labels, y_labels)

Check if a pandas Dataframe is suitable for instantiating a Dataset object.

compare_datasets(*datasets[, target])

rtype

None
